text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a beautiful vegetable side
dish
these are shelling beans also known as

and here they are cranberry beans I

come in these you know kind of dusty

and these just gorgeous

unfortunately they don't stay that color
they turn kind of a khaki but they are

gonna start this sauce pan on medium
heat splash of olive oil sliced garlic
not chopped not minced not crushed but
sliced we're gonna sizzle the garlic in
the oil for you know 30 seconds we don't
want to burn it we just want to toast it
super lightly so after about 30 seconds
of sizzling I'm gonna add about 1/2 a

stock eater I'm gonna throw in my
freshly shucked corn come on don't use

name for cranberry beans some currants
which are little beautiful sweet dried
raisin like objects some fresh tomato
some black pepper some salt and super
important freshly zested lemon so use a

down to the white it'll be bitter in
disgusting alright another splash of
stock and then we're gonna cook this on
medium-low I'm gonna simmer this for
about 45 minutes believe it or not I

going to throw in a pinch of fresh
oregano and and every once in a while

low simmering gently every once in a
while give it us
and if you need to give it a little

minutes until the beans are really

they shouldn't be melee or chalky they

about the texture you want you don't

so that's about the perfect texture I'm
gonna throw in some more fresh chopped
oregano fantastic herb to serve with

to top with some what's called gremolata

all that is is parsley raw garlic and
